page.title: 03A PICTURESQUE ROUTE
page.content: {The Railway Through Hamworthy The main line from{London Waterloo to {Weymouth}bisects the block passing through{Hamworthy. }The route traverses Poole Harbour and then Lytchett Bay over the Rockley Viaduct. This line is very picturesque,often passing over embankment flanked by water on each side. Many spectacular views may be seen from the train. A branch line,{Hamworthy}to{Wimbourne was closed several years ago. This line is still in evidence by way of embankments and cuttings. The embankment is being dug up to fill in some of Poole Harbour that is being reclaimed. Another branch line runs from {Hamworthy to Lower Hamworthy}but it carries only goods to the industries in Poole.
